label: Body Weight
description: The mass or quantity of heaviness of an individual. It is expressed by units of pounds or kilograms.

ols.label: body weight
ols.description: The mass or quantity of heaviness of an individual. It is expressed by units of pounds or kilograms.

label: Skeletal Muscle Mass
description: A measurement of the mass of all skeletal muscle in the body.

ols.label: Skeletal Muscle Mass
ols.description: A measurement of the mass of all skeletal muscle in the body.

label: Body Fat Percentage
description: The amount of an individual's total body mass that is fat, expressed as a percent.

ols.label: Body Fat Percentage
ols.description: The amount of an individual's total body mass that is fat, expressed as a percent.

label: Body Mass Index
description: An individual's weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.

ols.label: Body Mass Index
ols.description: An individual's weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: BMI calculated from height and weight

label: Basal Metabolic Rate
description: A patient's energy expenditure at rest.

ols.label: Basal Metabolic Rate
ols.description: A patient's energy expenditure at rest.

label: Total Body Water
description: A measurement of the quantity of water within the body, including both the intracellular and extracellular compartments.

ols.label: Total Body Water Measurement
ols.description: A measurement of the quantity of water within the body, including both the intracellular and extracellular compartments.

label: Extracellular Water
description: A measurement of the quantity of water in the extracellular compartments within the body.

ols.label: Extracellular Water Measurement
ols.description: A measurement of the quantity of water in the extracellular compartments within the body.

label: Intracellular Water
description: Intracellular water is found inside the cell. It contains dissolved substances and proteins which are necessary for all the vital cellular processes to take place. It is rich in the electrolyte potassium and low in the electrolyte sodium.

label: Visceral Fat Level
description: The amount of a visceral fat.

ols.label: visceral adipose tissue quantity
ols.description: The amount of a visceral fat.

label: Blood Protein Amount
description: The amount of a protein when measured in blood.

ols.label: blood protein amount
ols.description: The amount of a protein when measured in blood.

label: Blood Mineral Amount
description: The amount of a mineral when measured in blood.

ols.label: blood mineral amount
ols.description: The amount of a mineral when measured in blood.

label: Body Fat Mass
description: The amount of matter in the body of an organism that is fat or adipose tissue.

ols.label: body fat mass
ols.description: The amount of matter in the body of an organism that is fat or adipose tissue.

label: Lean Mass in Right Arm
description: Fat-free mass in right arm.

label: Lean Mass in Left Arm
description: Fat-free mass in left arm.

label: Lean Mass in Trunk
description: Fat-free mass in the trunk region.

label: Lean Mass in Right Leg
description: Fat-free mass in right leg.

label: Lean Mass in Left Leg
description: Fat-free mass in left leg.

label: Phase Angle
description: The phase angle (PhA), measured via bioelectrical impedance analysis, is considered an indicator of cellular health, where higher values reflect higher cellularity, cell membrane integrity, and better cell function.

label: Extracellular Water to Total Body Water Ratio Measurement
description: The determination of the ratio of extracellular water to total body water present in a sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage.

ols.label: Extracellular Water to Total Body Water Ratio Measurement
ols.description: The determination of the ratio of extracellular water to total body water present in a sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: Extracellular water to total body water ratio

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: We would like a description of this abbreviation.

label: Subject Identifier
description: A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize a trial or study subject.

ols.label: Subject Identifier
ols.description: A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize a trial or study subject.

label: Age
description: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

ols.label: Age
ols.description: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

label: Gender
description: Characteristics of people that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex. As a social construct, gender varies from society to society and can change over time. (Adapted from WHO.)

ols.label: Gender
ols.description: Characteristics of people that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex. As a social construct, gender varies from society to society and can change over time. (Adapted from WHO.)

label: Nationality
description: The status of belonging to a particular nation.

label: Occupation
description: The principal activity that a person does to earn money.

ols.label: Occupation
ols.description: The principal activity that a person does to earn money.

label: Education Level
description: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.

ols.label: Education Level
ols.description: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.

label: Blood Pressure Finding
description: A test result that reports the diastolic and systolic pressure of blood.

ols.label: Blood Pressure Finding
ols.description: A test result that reports the diastolic and systolic pressure of blood.

label: Heart Rate
description: The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute.

ols.label: Heart Rate
ols.description: The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute.

label: Respiratory Rate
description: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute.

ols.label: Respiratory Rate
ols.description: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute.

label: Oxygen Saturation Measurement
description: The measurement of the ratio of oxygenated hemoglobin to total hemoglobin in blood.

ols.label: Oxygen Saturation Measurement
ols.description: The measurement of the ratio of oxygenated hemoglobin to total hemoglobin in blood.

label: Body Temperature
description: A measurement of the temperature of the body.

ols.label: Body Temperature
ols.description: A measurement of the temperature of the body.

label: InBody Score
description: The InBody Score is a reflection of the overall evaluation of your body composition. The more muscle mass the body has the higher the score will be and can possibly score over 100 points. Note that very low-fat mass (below healthy ranges) will cause your score to drop.

label: Visceral Fat Area
description: Area of visceral fat, belly fat found deep within your abdominal cavity, that surrounds important organs, including your stomach, liver and intestines.

label: Waist-Hip Ratio
description: An average person who is reasonably balanced will generally score between 70-79 points. Higher is considered to be highly active and fit, lower indicates a lack of muscle or may be extremely underweight/overweight.

ols.label: Waist-Hip Ratio
ols.description: The ratio of the abdominal circumference at the navel to maximum hip and buttocks circumference; looks at the proportion of fat stored on the body around the waist and hip. Carrying extra weight around the waist is a greater health risk than carrying extra weight around the hips or thighs

label: Target Body Weight
description: A predetermined body weight goal based on health, fitness, or medical criteria, often used to guide weight management or treatment plans.

label: Weight Control
description: The suggested amount of weight to gain or lose to reach the ideal body composition, typically based on lean mass and body fat targets rather than just total weight.

label: Fat Control
description: The recommended amount of body fat to lose or gain to reach an optimal body fat percentage based on the individual's current body composition.

label: Muscle Control
description: The recommended amount of muscle mass to gain or lose to achieve a balanced and healthy body composition.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: It is unclear whether this refers to a specific test or a general retinal scan. If a particular software or specialized tool is used for this assessment, it would be helpful to define a variable name and provide a clear description within the core model to avoid confusion with similar tests.

label: Visual Acuity - Left Eye
description: A measure of the sharpness of vision in the left eye, assessed using a Snellen chart at a standardized distance, typically expressed as a fraction (e.g., 20/20), indicating the ability to discern letters or symbols of a specific size.

ols.label: Visual Acuity
ols.description: Sharpness of vision, the ability to discern fine detail.

label: Visual Acuity - Right Eye
description: A measure of the sharpness of vision in the right eye, assessed using a Snellen chart at a standardized distance, typically expressed as a fraction (e.g., 20/20), indicating the ability to discern letters or symbols of a specific size.

ols.label: Visual Acuity
ols.description: Sharpness of vision, the ability to discern fine detail.

label: Shoebox Auditory Test - Left Ear
description: A tablet-based hearing assessment of the left ear using calibrated headphones and the Shoebox Audiometry system to determine hearing thresholds across various frequencies, typically for screening or diagnostic purposes.

label: Shoebox Auditory Test - Right Ear
description: A tablet-based hearing assessment of the right ear using calibrated headphones and the Shoebox Audiometry system to determine hearing thresholds across various frequencies, typically for screening or diagnostic purposes.

label: Allergies
description: A documented list of substances (e.g., medications, foods, environmental agents) to which the individual has a known allergic reaction, based on clinical history or diagnostic testing.

label: Medical History
description: A medical history is a record of the events of a recipient of medical care.

ols.label: medical history
ols.description: A medical history is a record of the events of a recipient of medical care.

label: Surgical History
description: A clinical history that is about surgical operations performed on an individual

ols.label: surgical history
ols.description: A clinical history that is about surgical operations performed on an individual

label: Family History
description: Family history is a form of clinicaly history specifically about relevant aspects of genetic preconditions or family member's clinical history.

ols.label: family history
ols.description: Family history is a form of clinicaly history specifically about relevant aspects of genetic preconditions or family member's clinical history.

label: Falls Assessment
description: A clinical evaluation to identify a person's risk of falling, typically involving a review of medical history, mobility, balance, medication use, and environmental factors.

label: Pain Assessment
description: The evaluation of pain complaints. Measurements should be objective on the part of the practitioner, based on subjective information from the patient. Measurements may also be indirect, by such assessments as respiratory rate and effort, withdrawal, guarding, or other appropriate assessment techniques.

ols.label: Pain Assessment
ols.description: The evaluation of pain complaints. Measurements should be objective on the part of the practitioner, based on subjective information from the patient. Measurements may also be indirect, by such assessments as respiratory rate and effort, withdrawal, guarding, or other appropriate assessment techniques.

label: Montreal Cognitive Assessment
description: An alternate version of MOCA v8 that can be administered to decrease any potential test re-test interactions

ols.label: Montreal Cognitive Assessment, Version 8.3
ols.description: An alternate version of MOCA v8 that can be administered to decrease any potential test re-test interactions

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: Please specify which version of the MoCA test will be used in the study.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: We would appreciate a description of this abbreviation.

label: Diagnosis
description: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ols.label: Diagnosis
ols.description: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

label: ICD Code
description: The alphanumeric code assigned to an entity in the International Classification of Diseases (ICD).

ols.label: ICD Code
ols.description: The alphanumeric code assigned to an entity in the International Classification of Diseases (ICD).

label: Diabetes Mellitus
description: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.

ols.label: Diabetes Mellitus
ols.description: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.

label: Hypertension
description: Blood pressure that is abnormally high.

ols.label: Hypertension
ols.description: Blood pressure that is abnormally high.

label: Cardiovascular Disorder
description: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.

ols.label: Cardiovascular Disorder
ols.description: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: Please indicate the data type that will be used to record this (e.g., boolean, list, etc.).

label: Dyslipidemia
description: A lipoprotein metabolism disorder characterized by decreased levels of high-density lipoproteins, or elevated levels of plasma cholesterol, low-density lipoproteins and/or triglycerides.

ols.label: Dyslipidemia
ols.description: A lipoprotein metabolism disorder characterized by decreased levels of high-density lipoproteins, or elevated levels of plasma cholesterol, low-density lipoproteins and/or triglycerides.

label: Obesity
description: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).

ols.label: Obesity
ols.description: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).

label: Chronic Kidney Disease
description: Impairment of the renal function secondary to chronic kidney damage persisting for three or more months.

ols.label: Chronic Kidney Disease
ols.description: Impairment of the renal function secondary to chronic kidney damage persisting for three or more months.

label: Cardiopulmonary Exercise Testing
description: A clinical tool to evaluate exercise capacity and to assess cardiac function under stress.

ols.label: Cardiopulmonary Exercise Testing
ols.description: A clinical tool to evaluate exercise capacity and to assess cardiac function under stress.

label: CPET - Absolute VO2 max
description: Maximum volume of oxygen consumed per minute during peak exercise, measured in liters per minute using cardiopulmonary exercise testing

label: CPET - Relative VO2 max
description: Maximum volume of oxygen consumed per minute during peak exercise, normalized to body weight and expressed in milliliters per kilogram per minute, as measured by cardiopulmonary exercise testing.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: We would like to know if this is a part of standard test and, if so, the specific test name. If not, we would appreciate details on the procedure used to obtain this score, as well as an explanation of what the score represents.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: We would like to know if this is a part of standard test and, if so, the specific test name. If not, we would appreciate information on how this measurement is conducted to define the variable clearly.

label: Electrocardiogram
description: A record of the electrical activity of the heart.

ols.label: Electrocardiogram
ols.description: A record of the electrical activity of the heart.

label: Magnetic Resonance Imaging
description: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ols.label: Magnetic Resonance Imaging
ols.description: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

label: Bone Mineral Content
description: An assessment of the quantity of minerals within a specific bone.

ols.label: Bone Mineral Content
ols.description: An assessment of the quantity of minerals within a specific bone.

label: Bone Mineral Density
description: A measure of the amount of minerals (mostly calcium and phosphorous) contained in a certain volume of bone. Bone mass measurements are used to diagnose osteoporosis (a condition marked by decreased bone mass), to see how well osteoporosis treatments are working, and to predict how likely the bones are to break. Low bone mass can occur in patients treated for cancer.

label: Bone Mineral Density T-Score
description: The standard deviation of the subject's bone mineral density score in comparison to the expected normal bone mineral density of a healthy 30-year old adult.

ols.label: Bone Mineral Density T-Score
ols.description: The standard deviation of the subject's bone mineral density score in comparison to the expected normal bone mineral density of a healthy 30-year old adult.

label: Bone Mineral Density Z-Score
description: A statistical score representing the number of standard deviations above or below what is expected for an individual's bone density based on his age, sex, weight, and race. Z-scores are most useful in evaluating low bone density in children, premenopausal women, and men younger than age fifty.

ols.label: Bone Mineral Density Z-Score
ols.description: A statistical score representing the number of standard deviations above or below what is expected for an individual's bone density based on his age, sex, weight, and race. Z-scores are most useful in evaluating low bone density in children, premenopausal women, and men younger than age fifty.

label: Fat Mass
description: The weight of the body fat associated with either a particular body part or the whole body.

ols.label: Fat Mass
ols.description: The weight of the body fat associated with either a particular body part or the whole body.

label: Fat-free Mass
description: The total mass of all body components excluding fat, including lean soft tissue (muscle, organs, body water) and bone mineral content (BMC).

label: Body Fat Percentage
description: The amount of an individual's total body mass that is fat, expressed as a percent.

ols.label: Body Fat Percentage
ols.description: The amount of an individual's total body mass that is fat, expressed as a percent.

label: Heart Rate Variability
description: Heart rate variability (HRV) is the psychological phenomenon of variation in the time interval between heartbeats. It is measured by the variation in the beat-to-beat interval

ols.label: heart rate variability
ols.description: Heart rate variability (HRV) is the psychological phenomenon of variation in the time interval between heartbeats. It is measured by the variation in the beat-to-beat interval

label: Respiratory Rate
description: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute.

ols.label: Respiratory Rate
ols.description: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, usually expressed as breaths per minute.

label: Resting Heart Rate
description: The number of heartbeats per minute while the body is at complete rest, typically measured after waking and before physical activity.

label: Sleep Consistency
description: A measure of how regularly a person goes to sleep and wakes up at the same times each day, expressed as a percentage indicating the stability of their sleep schedule over time.

label: Total Sleep Time
description: The total amount of sleep time from sleep onset to sleep offset, determined by summing the N1 sleep, N2 sleep, N3 sleep, and REM sleep durations.

ols.label: Total Sleep Time
ols.description: The total amount of sleep time from sleep onset to sleep offset, determined by summing the N1 sleep, N2 sleep, N3 sleep, and REM sleep durations.

label: Restorative Sleep
description: The portion of sleep that effectively supports physical recovery, mental rejuvenation, and overall well-being, typically characterized by adequate amounts of deep (slow-wave) and REM sleep.

label: Recovery
description: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health. The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

ols.label: Recovery
ols.description: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health. The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

studies.name: Study1
studies.description: As we understand it, this data comes from a wearable device manufactured by WHOOP. We would like to know what qualifies as a high stress zone and what parameters are used to determine it.

label: Daily Aerobic Activity
description: The total number of minutes per day spent performing moderate to vigorous aerobic exercise, such as walking, running, or cycling, that elevates heart rate and breathing.

label: WHOOP Strain Score
description: A proprietary, personalized exertion metric generated by the WHOOP wearable system, reflecting total cardiovascular and muscular effort during a day or activity. The strain score is a non-linear value from 0 to 21, calculated using heart rate dynamics and other physiological signals. It is designed to help users track intensity, optimize recovery, and balance training loads to enhance performance and prevent overtraining.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 1
description: MHLC Question 1 - If I get sick, it is my own behavior which determines how soon I get well again.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 2
description: MHLC Question 2 - I am in control of my health.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 3
description: MHLC Question 3 - When I get sick, I am to blame.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 4
description: MHLC Question 4 - The main thing which affects my health is what I myself do.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 5
description: MHLC Question 5 - If I take care of myself, I can avoid illness.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 6
description: MHLC Question 6 - If I take the right actions, I can stay healthy.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 7
description: MHLC Question 7 - No matter what I do, if I am going to get sick, I will get sick.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 8
description: MHLC Question 8 - Most things that affect my health happen to me by accident.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 9
description: MHLC Question 9 - Luck pays a big part in determining how soon I will recover from an illness.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 10
description: MHLC Question 10 - My good health is largely a matter of good fortune.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 11
description: MHLC Question 11 - No matter what I do, I'm likely to get sick.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 12
description: MHLC Question 12 - If it's meant to be, I will stay healthy.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 13
description: MHLC Question 13 - Having regular contact with my physician is the best way for me to avoid illness.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 14
description: MHLC Question 14 - Whenever I don't feel well, I should consult a medically trained professional.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 15
description: MHLC Question 15 - My family has a lot to do with my becoming sick or staying healthy.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 16
description: MHLC Question 16 - Health professionals control my health.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 17
description: MHLC Question 17 - Whenever I recover from an illness, it's usually because other people (for example, doctors, nurses, family, friends) have been taking good care of me.

label: Multidimensional Health Locus of Control - Question 18
description: MHLC Question 18 - Regarding my health, I can only do what my doctor tells me to do.

label: QRISK Cardiovascular Disease Score
description: An estimate of an individual's risk of developing cardiovascular disease over the next 10 years, calculated using factors such as age, sex, blood pressure, cholesterol levels, smoking status, and medical history.

ols.label: QRISK cardiovascular disease 10 year risk calculator score (observable entity)

label: Test2Prevent - Risk Score
description: A composite risk score generated by the Test2Prevent model, designed to quantify an individual's likelihood of developing or progressing toward a specific clinical outcome (e.g., disease onset, adverse event, hospitalization), based on predictive features.

label: Test2Prevent - Risk Category Interpretation
description: A categorical interpretation of the Test2Prevent risk score that assigns individuals to predefined risk strata (e.g., low, moderate, high), used for clinical decision-making or intervention targeting.
